text.0: yea this is good to taste and full of sweetness verily it is strong and rich in flavour.
text.1: no one may conquer indra in the battle when he hath drunken of the draught we offer.
text.2: this sweet juice here had mightiest power to gladden it boldened indra when he siaughtered vṛtra.
text.3: when he defeated Śambaras many onslaughts and battered down his nineand ninety ramparts.
text.4: this stirreth up my voice when i have drunk it this hath aroused from sleep my yearning spirit.
text.5: this sage hath measured out the six expanses from which no single creature is excluded.
text.6: this even this is he who hath created the breadth of earth the lofty height of heaven.
text.7: he formed the nectar in three headlong rivers soma supports the wide midair above us.
text.8: he found the wavy sea of brilliant colours in forefront of the dawns who dwell in brightness.
text.9: this mighty one the steer begirt by maruts hath propped the heavens up with a mighty pillar.
text.10: drink soma boldly from the beaker indra in war for treasures hero vṛtraslayer.
text.11: fill thyself full at the midday libation and give us wealth thou treasury of riches.
text.12: look out for us o indra as our leader and guide us on to gain yet goodlier treasure.
text.13: excellent guardian bear us well through peril and lead us on to wealth with careful guidance.
text.14: lead us to ample room o thou who knowest to happiness security and sunlight.
text.15: high indra are the arms of thee the mighty may we betake us to their lofty shelter.
text.16: set us on widest chariotseat o indra with two steeds best to draw o lord of hundreds.
text.17: bring us the best among all sorts of viands let not the foes wealth maghavan subdue us.
text.18: be gracious indra let my days be lengthened sharpen my thought as twere a blade of iron.
text.19: approve whatever words i speak dependent on thee and grant me thy divine protection.
text.20: indra the rescuer indra the helper hero who listens at each invocation.
text.21: Śakra i call indra invoked of many may indra maghavan prosper and bless us.
text.22: may helpful indra as our good protector lord of all treasures favour us with succour.
text.23: baffle our foes and give us rest and safety and may we be the lords of hero vigour.
text.24: may we enjoy the grace of him the holy yea may we dwell in his auspicious favour.
text.25: may helpful indra as our good preserver drive from us even from afar our foemen.
text.26: like rivers rushing down a slope o indra to thee haste songs and prayers and linked verses.
text.27: thou gatherest thunderer like widespread bounty kine water drops and manifold libations.
text.28: who lauds him satisfies him pays him worship een the rich noble still hath found him mighty.
text.29: with power as when one moves his feet alternate he makes the last precede the foremost follow.
text.30: famed is the hero as each strong mans tamer ever advancing one and then another.
text.31: king of both worlds hating the high and haughty indra protects the men who are his people.
text.32: he loves no more the men he loved aforetime he turns and moves away allied with others.
text.33: rejecting those who disregard his worship indra victorious lives through many autumns.
text.34: in every figure he hath been the mode this is his only form for us to look on.
text.35: indra moves multiform by his illusions for his bay steeds are yoked ten times a hundred.
text.36: here tvaṣṭar yoking to the car the bay steeds hath extended sway.
text.37: who will for ever stand upon the foemans side even when our princes sit at ease.
text.38: gods we have reached a country void of pasture the land though spacious was too small to hold us.
text.39: bṛhaspati provide in war for cattle find a path indra for this faithful singer.
text.40: day after day far from their seat he drove them alike from place to place those darksome creatures.
text.41: the hero slew the meanlyhuckstering dāsas varcin and Śambara where the waters gather.
text.42: out of thy bounty indra hath prastoka bestowed ten coffers and ten mettled horses.
text.43: we have received in turn from divodāsa Śambaras wealth the gift of atithigva.
text.44: ten horses and ten treasurechests ten garments as an added gift.
text.45: these and ten lumps of gold have i received from divodāsas hand.
text.46: ten cars with extra steed to each for the atharvans hundred cows.
text.48: thus sṛñjayas son honoured the bharadvājas recipients of all noble gifts and bounty.
text.49: lord of the wood be firm and strong in body be bearing us a brave victorious hero.
text.50: show forth thy strength compact with straps of leather and let thy rider win all spoils of battle.
text.51: its mighty strength was borrowed from the heaven and earth its conquering force was brought from sovrans of the wood.
text.52: honour with holy gifts the car like indras bolt the car bound round with straps the vigour of the floods.
text.53: thou bolt of indra vanguard of the maruts close knit to varuṇa and child of mitra.
text.54: as such accepting gifts which here we offer receive o godlike chariot these oblations.
text.55: send forth thy voice aloud through earth and heaven and let the world in all its breadth regard thee.
text.56: o drum accordant with the gods and indra drive thou afar yea very far our foemen.
text.57: thunder out strength and fill us full of vigour yea thunder forth and drive away all dangers.
text.58: drive hence o wardrum drive away misfortune thou art the fist of indra show thy firmness.
text.59: drive hither those and these again bring hither the wardrum speaks aloud as battles signal.
text.60: our heroes winged with horses come together let our carwarriors indra be triumphant.
